plants.name: Chrysanthemum morifolium
plants.description: Chrysanthemums are popular garden flowers admired for their vibrant blooms and rich cultural symbolism, especially in East Asia and Europe. They often bloom in autumn, brightening gardens with a variety of colors.
plants.location: Temperate regions worldwide, especially in East Asia, Europe, and North America
plants.funFact: Chrysanthemums symbolize longevity and rejuvenation in many cultures and are the official flower of the city of Chicago.

plants.name: Clivia miniata
plants.description: Clivia miniata is a shade-loving evergreen perennial native to South Africa, known for its striking clusters of trumpet-shaped orange flowers. It typically blooms in late winter to autumn in the Southern Hemisphere.
plants.location: South Africa and cultivated worldwide in warmer climates
plants.funFact: Clivia flowers can stay fresh on the plant for up to two months, making it a favorite for indoor floral displays.

plants.name: Calanthe triplicata
plants.description: A terrestrial orchid native to tropical Asia and the Pacific, Calanthe triplicata produces large, fragrant white to pale green flowers that bloom in autumn, often around October to December.
plants.funFact: Unlike many orchids, Calanthe triplicata grows on the ground rather than epiphytically on trees.

plants.name: Solidago canadensis
plants.description: A wildflower native to North America, this species produces tall spikes of small, bright yellow flowers in late summer to autumn. It plays a crucial role in supporting pollinators during the fall.
plants.location: North America, often in fields and roadsides
plants.funFact: Goldenrod is often mistakenly blamed for hay fever, but it is the allergenic ragweed that blooms simultaneously.
